cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across Florida’s Big Bend on Monday, then emerging off the southeast U.S. coast Tuesday and racing northeast well offshore of New England toward the Canadian Maritimes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola/Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch north of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeast Georgia, coastal South and North Carolina, then open Atlantic southeast of New England
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–30 mph possible as the storm passes well southeast of Cape Cod late Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston Harbor; only elevated surf along exposed Atlantic beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain, generally 0.5–1.0 inch, peaking late Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip-currents could disrupt pilot transfers and small-craft operations off Massachusetts Bay
